title: Giles The collection 2018
notes: Nice drawings, and memorable from childhood, but pretty dated and never that funny.

title: The Best of A. A. Gill
notes: Outstanding. Very funny, which I expected, but also top notch observations and hugely moving writing across loads of subjects.

title: Girl In A Band
notes: Decent without being great. Lots of lists of names, not obviously name-dropping, but not sure what it really added. Much more interesting when talking about the work. and what great work.

title: Why Iâ€™m No Longer Talking to White People About Race
notes: The first audio book I've listened to in thirty plus years. Glad I did. Super educational and sobering.

title: I Believe in Miracles
notes: Fun purchase for a super easy read about the first football I really remembered. I was allowed to stay up late to watch the 1978 European Cup Final and the image of Trevor Francis tumbling onto the hammer circle after scoring the winner is indelible. Fun stories and footbal talk.
